physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph of a royal charter. The royal charter is placed within an opened frame case. It is held in place with an oval-shaped holder in the center. The case is standing on a table. In the background, there are several chairs and tables seen on the right and left of the photograph. The photograph is slightly faded, especially on the bottom-left. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of Royal Charter conferring Singapore's city status
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Charters
